snippet: Sales at stores open at least a year crept up just 0.8 percent from a year ago, half of what analysts had expected, but rose 3.6 percent when excluding drugstores, in line with analyst forecasts.
abstract: Thomson Reuters reports retail sales growth slowed in September among 19 major American retailers, dragged down by a decline in drugstore sales; sales at stores open at least a year rose 0.8 percent from September 2011.
lead_paragraph: Sales at stores open at least a year crept up just 0.8 percent from a year ago, half of what analysts had expected, but rose 3.6 percent when excluding drugstores, in line with analyst forecasts.

headline.main: Retailers Say Sales Slowed in September
headline.print_headline: Retailers Say Sales Slowed in September
